resources.string: (541) 653-8371 "\n"520 Commercial St Unit F, Eugene, OR 97402
Brewery focused on local ingredients offering a tasting room, patio seating and regular guided tours.
Laid-back brewery and tasting room offering more than 20 craft beers on tap, plus an outdoor patio.
Sam Bond\'s Brewing Company is a 10 bbl brewhouse and tasting room within the historic Foundry Building and conveniently located between downtown Eugene and the University of Oregon.
Cozy spot with elevated pub fare and beer, wine, cider, craft soda and cold-pressed espresso all on tap.
We are a family owned gastropub, brewery, and cider house located in the heart of Eugene campus culture.
Wide variety of beers on tap along with rotating food carts. In close proximity to downtown Eugene, Skinner Butte and the Ruth Bascom Riverbank Path.
Roomy, rustic-chic haunt offering house brews on tap, food carts and live music most weekend nights.
Claim 52 is a community-scale brewery serving our hometown of Eugene and surrounding areas since 2012.

Viking Braggot Company is the only brewery to offer a full line of braggots! What are braggots? It is one of the oldest fermented drinks, pioneered by the Vikings that takes elements of beer and fermented honey (or mead).

The Bier Stein is a connoisseur beer store located in Eugene, OR. We host over 30 evolving taps, 1,000 different bottles of beer from around the world, and have a menu of excellent sandwiches, soups, and fresh salads.
Bustling restaurant specializing in Belgian-style waffles loaded with sweet & savory toppings.
DickieJo’s Burgers is a fast casual restaurant specializing in griddle-pressed burgers, French fries and premium soft serve shakes.
Thai & Pacific Rim standards & specials offered in a modern, sophisticated room plus large patio.
Trendy counter serve with a patio for tacos & other Mexican bites, plus draft beer & margaritas.
Sushi, ramen & cocktails, plus a few Korean classics, offered in a warm, convivial atmosphere.
Brails is an American diner-style restaurant serving breakfast and lunch. Enjoy classic diner fare such as bacon and eggs, burgers, and Reuben sandwiches.
Casual American spot serving big burgers & sandwiches in a converted house with a beer garden.
Polished bistro with French-inspired & Northwest farm-to-table eats, a wood-fired oven & a full bar.
Guests at this exceptional restaurant can enjoy authentic Italian cuisine in the casual yet elegant Bistro, or in the formal Dining Room.
Strip-mall Chinese restaurant serving up Sichuan–style dishes in an intimate setting.
Hult Center for the Performing Arts
(541) 346-4461 "\n"2700 Martin Luther King Jr Blvd, Eugene, OR 97401

Hendricks Park is the oldest city park in Eugene, Oregon, United States. The 78-acre park is a little over a mile away from the University of Oregon campus, and contains mature forest, a 12-acre rhododendron garden, and a native plant garden.
The University of Oregon is a public flagship research university in Eugene, Oregon. Founded in 1876, the institution\'s 295-acre campus is along the Willamette River.

Skinner Butte is a prominent hill on the north edge of downtown Eugene, Oregon, United States, near the Willamette River. Skinner Butte is a local landmark and the location of Skinner Butte Park, a municipal park.

The area\'s premier shopping destination. Enjoy a collection of unique and enchanting stores, restaurants and eateries adjacent to an upscale boutique hotel. Stroll through the courtyard. Listen to the splashing sounds of the fountain. Sip on local wines. Connect with friends.

Autzen Stadium is an outdoor football stadium in the northwest United States, in Eugene, Oregon. Located north of the University of Oregon campus, it is the home field of the Oregon Ducks of the Pac-12 Conference.
The Hult Center for the Performing Arts is a performing arts venue in Eugene, Oregon.
Pretty park with floral displays, picnic areas, biking & pedestrian paths & a performance space.
Alton Baker Park is located in Eugene, Oregon, United States, near Autzen Stadium. It was named for Register-Guard founder Alton F. Baker, Sr.
The Shelton McMurphey Johnson House, or Castle on the Hill, in Eugene, Oregon, United States, is a Victorian-era residence that is listed on the National Register of Historical Places.
The Oregon Air and Space Museum, located on the grounds of the Eugene Airport in Eugene, Oregon, holds a collection of historic aircraft and spacecraft.
This weekly market in a park features wares by 200+ local artisans, plus food vendors & live music.
Celebrate local Scandinavian heritage with food, crafts and entertainment at Junction City\'s 58th Scandinavian Festival.
The Whiteaker Block Party held in August of each year is just one of Eugene’s outlandish and entertaining summertime festivities.
Have you driven by a food truck and wished there were a place where you could try all of Eugene’s food trucks? Well the Annual Food Truck Fest is your place.

Watch cowboys and cowgirls compete in Roughstock, bareback riding, Saddle Bronc Riding, bull riding, barrel racing, steer wrestling and roping events. There will be rodeo clowns, kids games and more carnival food than you could ever eat!
The Oregon Country Fair is a nonprofit organization, and an annual three-day fair held outside the city limits of Veneta, Oregon, United States.
Oregon Bach Festival has presented the masterworks of J.S. Bach, and composers inspired by his work, to audiences in Eugene and throughout the State of Oregon for nearly five decades.
